subject: FW: Re: Guess they want it shared!
author: Travis
full_text:
When I made my station to stream to Second Life I used Shout Cast. 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoutcast I did it with MP3's and other 
Audio Files, but since this will be a "Live" Stream all youd have to 
do is figure out a way to use shoutcast with a Live feed from your 
desktop or whatever pc/server youll be using on your side. It should 
be relatively easy.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> So what do you use, something like Real Audio?
> 
> Frank-S
> 
> 
> >From: "Travis" <vampire2kd@...>

> >Date: Fri, 03 Aug 2007 15:45:57 -0000
> >
> >Thats what I trying to say though, I made my own internet radio
> >channel to play my own music straight off of a computer on my own
> >network without having to pay for any provider or anything extra. 
So
> >basically what I was saying is I made my own radio station for my 
own
> >purpose I could access anywhere for free. =-) The ghost box though
> >thats up to you, Take your time Im sure everyone will wait to give 
it
> >a try. Things that require a wait are usually worth the wait =-)
> >
> >
> >--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@>
> >wrote:
> > >
> > > Yep, that's pretty much what the originator of the idea came up

provider.
> > >

> > > >From: "Travis" <vampire2kd@>

> > > >Well there is audio streaming software out there, for instance 
the
> > > >software that is used to set up an internet radio stream. I 
had my
> > > >own station set up (just for me though) to stream to the 
virtual
> > > >world of Second Life. That way instead of listening to just any
> > > >stream I had a set up so I could listen to the music off 
another
> >one
> > > >of my boxes and have it streamed directly into Second Life. 
This is
> > > >completely different though but if you have another box you 
can use
> > > >as a server you could set up (or possibly someone else) a 
internet
> > > >radio stream, to connect we would use your ip and possibly use
> > > >something like winamp to connect to the stream. It will most 
likely
> > > >come out a bit laggy but if you have decent cable connection 
and
> >you
> > > >are only using it for a timed session obviously it wouldnt be 
that
> > > >bad.I guess it all depends.
> > > >   Now if you are talking streaming 24/7 then its a whole 
different
> > > >thing. Regards,
> > > >               T.L.
> > > >--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-
boxes@>
> > > >wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Yeah, but I think bandwidth will be a problem. I'm far 
behind on
> > > >the
> > > > > software end of it, but hopefully someone out there has some
> >ideas.
> > > > > Supplying the box is the easy part!
> > > > >
> > > > > Frank
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > >From: "psi_research" <vilhellm@>

> > > > > >
> > > > > >I like the idea a lot. Its easy to wonder about possible
> > > >interaction
> > > > > >with the Box from anywhere. Different people receiving 
personal
> > > > > >messages simultaneously is something I've already observed 
in
> > > >sessions
> > > > > >where you have multiple people present. It will be 
interesting
> >to
> > > >run
> > > > > >a box session on the network for a specified time and have
> > > >listeners
> > > > > >post the messages they heard on the forum so results can be
> > > >compared.
> > > > > >
> > > > > >-Bill
> > > > > >

> > > > > ><paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:

<franks-

> >requires
> > > >only

and
> > > >sending

> > > > > > > > over the internet, which I have no idea how to do the 
soft
> > > >ware
> > > > > > > > part, but the guy that suggested seems to.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >  I'm sure that people in different locations would get
> > > >different
> > > > > > > > messages although, presumalby, the box was outputing 
only
> >a
> > > >single
> > > > > > > > stream of information.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >  This is something to be excited about. It could be 
just
> > > >weeks away.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >  Frank-S

> >wrote:

> > > > > > > > > Thats an awesome idea. imagine though its streaming 
live
> > > >across
> > > > > > > > cables
> > > > > > > > > throughout the states. The possibility of the audio
> >being
> > > >further
> > > > > > > > > influenced is greater Im sure. Reminds me of when a
> >radio
> > > >show was
> > > > > > > > > being done on evps people recording the show played 
it
> >back
> > > >later
> > > > > > > > to
> > > > > > > > > listen again and heard messages to them during the 
play
> > > >back and
> > > > > > > > this
> > > > > > > > > was being reported from tons of people. So its 
pretty
> > > >interesting
> > > > > > > > if
> > > > > > > > > you can actually have this done, cant wait to see 
what
> > > >happens.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption"
> ><franks-
> > > >boxes@>
> > > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > It's like DAH!!! Why I not think about this!? 
Setup an
> > > >internet
> > > > > > > > server
> > > > > > > > > > (somehow) and connect a box to the internet to run
> >24/7---
> > > >-
> > > > > > > LIVE.
> > > > > > > > Or
> > > > > > > > > make
> > > > > > > > > > coordinated short tests so remote reception can be
> > > >compared to
> > > > > > > > > local. It
> > > > > > > > > > would be an easy task to make modes and bands
> >switchable
> > > > > > > > remotely as
> > > > > > > > > well.
> > > > > > > > > > What about multiple boxes?
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Just imagine, a box accessible to the world 24 
hours a
> > > >day,
> > > > > > > seven
> > > > > > > > > days a
> > > > > > > > > > week! It staggers the imagination! Given the 
nature
> >of the
> > > > > > > > voices and
> > > > > > > > > > contacts, I wouldn't be surprised if several 
people
> >could
> > > > > > > access
> > > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > system
> > > > > > > > > > at the exact same time, yet all receive personal
> > > >communications.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Guess that would create wee ripple in the 
darkside!!
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > I wasn't sure if the originator of the idea 
wanted his
> > > >name out
> > > > > > > > > there, I
> > > > > > > > > > took it off.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Frank-S

> >don't
> > > >have
> > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > > >resuources to

time,
> >plus
> > > > > > > trying
> > > > > > > > ot find
> > > > > > > > > > >waay to
> > > > > > > > > > > > make the things more better. I am no engineer,
> >and it
> > > >takes
> > > > > > > a
> > > > > > > > > while to
> > > > > > > > > > > > figure things out--as with all aspects of this
> >life.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > Frank-S
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Hey Frank,
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Its me again
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >I haven't had much time to work on ITC lately 
but I'm
> > > > > > > > interested in
> > > > > > > > > > >taking a slightly different approach using a 
quantum
> > > >random
> > > > > > > > number
> > > > > > > > > > >generator (unless its cost prohibitive) and 
computer
> > > >(hoping it
> > > > > > > > > > >doesn't get fried).
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >But... what are your thoughts on this:
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >What if we hooked up one of your boxes to the
> >internet
> > > >for
> > > > > > > > remote
> > > > > > > > > > >users to attempt interaction with?  Leaning on 
the
> >non-
> > > > > > > locality
> > > > > > > > theory.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Couple things I'm wondering about, assuming it 
works:
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >- Would the box work "better" physically present 
at
> > > >a "high
> > > > > > > > energy"
> > > > > > > > > > >location?  I'm refering to locations on Earth 
that
> >are
> > > >known
> > > > > > > to
> > > > > > > > be
> > > > > > > > > > >high energy from lay lines, etc. "portals".
> > > > > > > > > > >- Will the recorded audio from your box be the 
same
> > > >recorded
> > > > > > > or
> > > > > > > > heard
> > > > > > > > > > >audio at the remote location?  Meaning will the 
EVP
> >be
> > > > > > > > recordable at
> > > > > > > > > > >your location or only the remote users 
location?  Or
> >if
> > > >both,
> > > > > > > > will
> > > > > > > > > > >they match?
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Just some things I've been thinking about lately.
> > > >Curious
> > > > > > > what
> > > > > > > > you
> > > > > > > > > think.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Thanks,
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > >
